New Records: The Dodgers had the longest scoreless streak to close out a playoff series in the 21st century, and third-longest in the history of the sport
Key Match Events: Evan Phillips, Alex Vesia, Michael Kopech, and Blake Treinen came on in that order, retiring the final 12 hitters they faced
Phillips earned three strikeouts and held the red-hot Fernando Tatis Jr. in check with a liner off the end of his bat
Michael Kopech absolutely bullied the bottom of that order with his 100+ mph heaters
Pre-Game Insights: Dave Roberts made the switch to start the sixth even though Yamamoto's pitch count was well in hand because he didn't want his starter facing that powerful lineup for a third time
Post-Match Reflections: Roberts trusted the full strength of the arms at his disposal, unwilling to ride the hot hand through gut-feeling or any other rationalization
The Dodgers held San Diego to 24 straight scoreless frames
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dating back to the Friars Game 3 win, in which they scored all six runs in the second, the Dodgers held San Diego to 24 straight scoreless frames
Others: The Dodgers' bullpen held the Padres to 22 scoreless innings in the other four games, even including the highly-contested 6-5 loss in Game 3
